website_summaries.verdict: With spray-gun results from an aerosol can, this high-quality clear coat is the one to use for a high-gloss finish on smaller projects like headlights, bumpers, hoods, and even motorcycle touch-ups.
pros: Unique nozzle design gives spray-gun results
Provides protection against abrasion and scratching
cons: Product will solidify in the can within a matter of hours, so be ready to work when you puncture it
Be sure to use eye protection, proper breathing equipment, and skin protection when you apply

customer_reviews.title: Great material. BUT
customer_reviews.text: Great material. BUT, please adhere to instructions. This stuff can cost you your health. Really surprised it is available on the open market. Is labeled to be used by professionals only. Can't stress enough to follow precautions. Body, eye, breathing instructions. Don't be macho with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jack R. Bosch

customer_reviews.title: Great product highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: First time I have used. Amazing results on motorcycle tank and fenders painted with Rustoleum Professional Auto Enamel can purchased at Home Depot. Went on easy and buffed out to a wonderful gloss finish that looks professional. Be sure to utilize proper protective wear including 3M respirator mask, goggles, gloves, suit. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This is beautiful in finish and it lasts for a long time ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the product for your headlight lenses. First polish with progressive paper 1000 1200 2000 then buff with colorback or similar. Give 3 or four careful sprays - dry between. This is beautiful in finish and it lasts for a long time - years!
customer_reviews.author: Ricky L Ramming

customer_reviews.title: Spray Adhesive not Gloss
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the product with the hopes that I could use it in lieu of epoxy resin. I "activated" the can and heard the hissing noise. I assumed it was activating. In any case, when I applied this to three different glass jars that had glitter applied to them, it just sprayed as a matte adhesive. It isn't shiny or have a clear gloss at all. I may have activated it incorrectly or something. I would be interested in trying again, but I don't want to purchase another can to have it go wrong again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Marenco

customer_reviews.title: Worst Spray I have ever seen come out of a can
customer_reviews.text: I had done a small repair on my truck using 1k clear coat, but it just wasn't shiny enough even after buffing. After reading the reviews, I thought I would try this. I followed directions, it was a warm day, but the spray can spit so bad it ended up looking like my truck had measles. I ended up just taking my truck into my normal body guy who had to sand off the entire mess and respray. It ended up costing my hundreds. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tomich

customer_reviews.title: One day later the parts looks like they are wrapped in glass over top of HOK ...
customer_reviews.text: Took 2 cans of this to put 3 coats on a motorcycle gas tank, fenders and a few other small parts. One day later the parts looks like they are wrapped in glass over top of HOK Cobalt Blue. I got it a little heavy on one side of the tank to the point it actually dripped off, but it settled down perfectly flat. Idiot proof. N.B.: Make sure you get the $20 respirator and have good fresh air coming in/bad air out - this stuff will kill you quick!
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: First time using spray clear results
customer_reviews.text: Ok this was my first time using a spray can clear. You’ll probably need more than you think, it goes fast. Make sure your properly ventilated and use the correct grade mask filter! VERY IMPORTANT This stuff will absolutely destroy you if you do not use with good ventilation and mask filters. No joke Was not super easy to use but I got better and got the hang of it. Have seen a finished product with a different brand and this one seems like top notch quality in comparison This is easier in some ways then spraying with a gun but in some ways more difficult too. I’d say this is best suited for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.author: Tyler S.

customer_reviews.title: This Stuff Is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is the most amazing product I've ever used and seen. With proper surface prep the results are amazing. As good as a professional clear coating. I used this on the peeling front cap of my motor home after using rattle can automotive "clearcoat" every year with limited success and failure. It always looked streaked and uneven. Three coats of this stuff left a smooth, glossy finish with very little effort. Be sure to wear full protective gear as stated. This stuff is a mix of paint and SuperGlue so eye, lung, skin protection is a MUST. And don't skimp on masking anything you don't want overspray on. Getting it off will be a non starter.
customer_reviews.author: Buying FrenzyTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Does what its supposed to
customer_reviews.text: Used to touch up a failed clearcoat patch on the roof of a silver car. Scuffed up with a gray scotch brite pad and smoothed with some 1500 wet and wiped down with prep. Did not spray the entire roof and blended the soft mask line. Some more 1500 wet and then compounded out with glaze and it looks pretty good. Not anything a reputable body shop would do of course but for the price it looks 90% better and passes to 4 foot test with ease. I believe I have at least stopped the progression of the coating deterioration while cosmetically improving the situation. I suppose time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: This DOES NOT leave a glossy finish
customer_reviews.text: This is not high gloss clear coat that an automobile would have. It’s semi gloss. Looks like crap but fortunately it’s better than what it looked like before. Just doesn’t look like I wanted it to. Paid for gloss and it did not deliver at all. Also don’t tilt the can more than 30 degrees or you’ll start getting inconsistent spray as less paint and more air come out of the nozzle. I don’t recommend this product if you’re looking to replace your glossy automotive finish.
customer_reviews.author: Chucky69

customer_reviews.title: This clear coat is far superior to regular clear coats you can find at the store.
customer_reviews.text: I've been painting my car and using the product for my clear coat protection. It leaves a nice hard protective coat which you can sand without worrying about burning through it. Of course, you have to still be cautious with any sanding, especially on ridges and curves. It's been a learning process and I would probably lean toward spraying more rather than less clear coat to give yourself extra thickness so you can sand more aggressively. I used some of this clear coat about two years ago on my front bumper and it still looks good. This time, I'm doing the whole car.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Lucas

customer_reviews.title: As good as commercial clear coat
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased about half a dozen cans of this stuff. Undoubtedly the best rattle can clearcoat out there, and it's pretty damn close to an auto body clearcoat job. I've used it on the front as rear bumpers on my truck, and also used it on the tank and fenders on my motorcycle with great results. so I can say with confidence it's works on metal as good as it works on plastic. One word of advice, prepping is key, make sure you follow the directions and the temp/humidity is ideal. This stuff also wet sands and polishes well, but make sure you have enough coats down to do it.
customer_reviews.author: Dapper Doppleganger

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions on the can exactly as written.
customer_reviews.text: This will lay down a high gloss without question. Just be absolutely sure the surface is flawless, and apply exactly as the directions state. Applying a second coat too soon will cause runs or the orange peel look. Conversely, wait too long and you won’t have perfect adhesion. Once done, don’t touch it for a minimum of 24 hours, 48 is even better. Finally when wet sanding, mix soap into the water and turn or replace the sand paper frequently, and sand with light pressure. Trust my advice. I did all the wrong things and ended up stripping it all and redoing it.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Ochwat

customer_reviews.title: Old school dude says...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this product before and liked it then and like it now. An aquaintence of mine- 60 something year old Bodyman- used what was left in my can since it has a shelf life. He used the half a can I had left. Later he told me it's the best paint in a can he's ever used. He's old school too so if he concurs it's good, you can be sure it is. It'd be nice if you could check the date on MFR on can but that's a luxury. Stuff can go bad if it sits too long.
customer_reviews.author: S. Short

customer_reviews.title: Best 2 part clear coat in a can.
customer_reviews.text: If u follow directions this is the best 2 part clear coat u can buy in a can. It dries harder than the paint. I used it to clear coat car parts and a boat engine cover. This stuff is amazing and saved me having to bring my parts to a professional paint shop. If u use this u will need a resperator as the fumes are very toxic. U can get a cheap full face resperator with filters on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: This clear coat is amazing. I used it to cover my base coat ...
customer_reviews.text: This clear coat is amazing. I used it to cover my base coat (Duplicolor Black) on the roof of my Jeep Liberty and I couldn't have asked for better results. Just follow the instructions on the can. Definitely get a respirator for painting as the fumes from this stuff will do some harm. Other than the fumes there is no reason to not use this on projects where your clear coat has to shine! I'll be using this on ALL of my car projects where the clear coat needs to last.
customer_reviews.author: B. Knerien

customer_reviews.title: Push the red button all the way in
customer_reviews.text: Just a word of advice Read all the other reviews Respirator yes, it covered well, bit of orange peel, but looks great My two cents is regarding the red button on the bottom - very hard to push I painted a whole bunch of bike parts without pressing the red button all the way and it didn’t look that good Second can wasn’t pushing in at all on the bottom so I really leaned on it and then it went down - needless to say this can looked a lot better
customer_reviews.author: Neil Burton

customer_reviews.title: Great for headlight restoration
customer_reviews.text: When you want to do headlight restoration correctly...this is a great product for the process. After sanding with 400 and 600 grit auto sandpaper, my headlights were SprayMax 2K clear coat. The easy 30 second step to activate the solutions in the can, even spray, and fantastic outcome were exactly what the doctor ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Salisbury

customer_reviews.title: A really fine product.
customer_reviews.text: Make sure you wear a mask, eye protection and long sleeves. This stuff is volatile. That said, it went on nicely. It was rock hard in a few hours. It's really great stuff. I made certain my carbon fiber muffler was lightly sanded and cleaned with isopropyl alcohol. Use light coats, separated by 10 minutes. Don't apply it thick. I had a run so the next morning, I was able to sand it and the can was still good, 22 hours later. I gave it a fine finish mist to cover the sand marks.
customer_reviews.author: M. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: It's got a learning curve!
customer_reviews.text: Product has far less than a traditional spray pain can, I assume due to the hardener canister inside the can. I was only able to partially finish my project before running out of paint and having to buy another can... Kind of annoying. Spray pattern isnt the most consistent either! Has occasional sputtering and left orange peel in those spots. However, its not all negative! Since this was my first time using the product, I know what to expect and this should give a durable, glossy, and UV resistant finish my next attempt!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product,  Great Results
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with 1K clear coats from hardware stores. This 2K high gloss clear coat is the real deal. Anyone who knows automotive painting will tell you that proper prep work is paramount and you need to do that first before any painting and clear coating. My hood repair went well and I used this Spray Max High Gloss product and it looks great and no orange peel Of course, if you have a paint booth, air compressor and a serious air gun and all the other equipment then you can forget about this easy to use great product.
customer_reviews.author: Burner

customer_reviews.title: Just freaking amazing. Buy it now
customer_reviews.text: Just freaking amazing. Buy it now! The air pressure is perfect, like a HVLP paint gun, nothing like a regular spray can's pressure. This thing puts paint down JUST like a real detail gun. You have to be a goof ball to screw up this paint job. It's drying now but I'll post it up shortly. It is WELL WORTH the money. You aren't buying a $22 spray can, you ARE buying a $22 Professional 1 time use paint gun!
customer_reviews.author: XJfan

customer_reviews.title: Much better than compete products...
customer_reviews.text: Overall, produces a great finish, but can be tricky to use, as you should expect with a rattle can. I used on a small area and then on a larger area. Large area shows some streaking you typically get from using spray cans. But small area looks as good as new. Overall, you'll get the look you want with patience and practice.
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn, NY

customer_reviews.title: good product, not for automotive.
customer_reviews.text: the instructions are virtually nonexistant as far as dry times etc, but it says how to mix it. i mixed it very well. but after 3 coats and letting it dry in a dry and warm shop for 4 days, i can scratch it with my fingernail. not a light scratch, i mean i can dig in. i used it for a front fender on a motorcycle. imagine how its gonna handle pebbles or literally anything flying at it at 60mph on the freeway. anyway i would find something else if you want to use this for automotive applications.
customer_reviews.author: micos

customer_reviews.title: Forget the cheap cans
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used a lot of rattle can clears and this one is the best I’ve ever used. Wide nozzle with an even spray pattern makes applicant easy. Don’t be scared with this being a 2 part it lays down flat and even the most heavy trigger finger this paint will level out. Used it to re finish my old crusty headlights after using other parts store “uv protected” clear. After a few months the cheaper stuff turns yellow and chips offs, not this stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Fuerte

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Used to cover dry carbon fiber to bring out the beauty of the weave. Make sure you get the can warm by setting it in the sun or in a bowl of warm water before inserting the pin and shaking the can for a while. Lays smooth on carbon fiber, but I think the defects I encountered were from a lack of patience. Had I lightly sanded between coats, the solvent pop and orange peel on one corner could've been easily worked out. Will buy this brand again due to my result this time and knowledge of working time I have between coats.
customer_reviews.author: Average Customer

customer_reviews.title: Flat Can
customer_reviews.text: Received a bad can. Followed directions, but the inner can did not release any thing. Dead silent. Tried to use just the uncatalyzed clear coat, did not adhere well. In theory, the product sounds great, but my particular can must have been on a slow boat from (made in Germany). Not blaming the seller at all, as there is no way to insure that this type of aerosol product will activate without actually doing it. Completed my project with a different single stage clear coat.
customer_reviews.author: Hiker Frank

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: if you are looking for a great finish to a spray paint-paint job, this stuff is ten times better than using the off the shelf stuff. Although the cost is significantly higher than the single stage stuff from the hardware store, the finish is so much better. i learned the hard way after repeatedly having to redo the finish by going cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Works great over VHT Nite Shades
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Have used this on two different vehicles to create a high gloss finish over the top of VHT Nit Shades. I originally used a Dulicolor clear and it deteriorated after about a year. The first vehicle I used this on still looked great after 3 years. I did 2 light coats of the Night Shades and let it sit for 12 hours and then did a light coat, a medium coat and a heavy coat of the clear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Finally got around to using this, I was expecting pure quality and I never got to expierance it as when I went to use it it would not spray , almost like there was no air pressure from the can , just a little gasp of air and nothing so had to throw it out since I had it over the return date but only had it for about 2 months and it sat in my closet the whole time. Just not worth the Hassel of attempting to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Super

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I did a roof and two headlights. Great stuff. WEAR A DECENT MASK! it is very toxic. Learn from my noob mistakes: Hold it closer to the surface, like intentionally 6" or so. Move slowly and evenly. Too far away and it will send half-dried bits into the clear coat. I had no experience. One or two spray/coats is all you need. Doing more makes it worse. Don't be afraid to toss out whatever amount is left in the can.
customer_reviews.author: steelnotplastic

customer_reviews.title: Laid down nicely in 95°
customer_reviews.text: Laid it down in 95° weather, sun down, but it laid down quite nicely. Lots of orange peel, went through about 3 rounds of 2000 grit wet sand to get it all down, but overall quite pleased with a rattle can paint job. I tried to stretch it a bit too far, I tried to cover a hood AND grille, I’d say one can per panel is a good rule of thumb. I got about two solid coats on both. First timer, happy with result. Will post pics when polished. Careful of overspray. Thank god I had paint thinner for my windows, the overspray is heavier than paint.
customer_reviews.author: D N

customer_reviews.title: best clearcoat in a rattle can
customer_reviews.text: i bought this clear coat for a do-it-yourself paint your car project using rattlecans. my car had a lot of peeling clearcoat and the paint was in pretty bad shape so i sanded everything and painted/clearcoated it. it doesn't look perfect but it looks a lot better than it did. this type of clear coat has a separate hardener that you mix with it built in so it is a better quality than a 1k clear.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Morris

customer_reviews.title: Professional results in a spray can
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed by results with this product. I have painted the same set of bumpers twice to color match my truck and the clear coat looks just like factory. Make sure to wear a respirator as this paint is unbelievably harmful but the results are great, if you have experience painting. This needs to be applied somewhat wet from the first coat, if you see dusting , keep spraying until the paint looks wet. Cut and buff after a week or two.
customer_reviews.author: Pawel Polak

customer_reviews.title: I used this to re-clear coat some headlights as well as some small trim pieces
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is the real deal. It is just like automotive clear coat, except for one aspect. This stuff hardens, meaning it is not happy to bend or flex unlike most paints from OEM. So if it is used on a polyurethane bumper, and some flex occurs, it will likely crack . But it is chemical resistant!! I will definitely be using this to re-clear some panels and other automotive paint project I have.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Factory clear coat in a can
customer_reviews.text: I used this on headlights. Wow the can sprays nicely. Very minimum orange peel look. It matches a new paint job on cars today in regard to orange peel effect. Do not use unless you have oxygen mask and are covered head to toe including eyes. Highly toxic product but quality. It's literally clear coat like a new car would get but in a can. Prep work is key like all other paint jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan W.

customer_reviews.title: Dripity drip drip drippy
customer_reviews.text: First can had some drips and came off in large patches when wet sanded). Tried again. Second can dripped even more. I was not spraying heavy. I was using a can gripper handle. By the third light coat it was dripping like rain. $40 down the drain. The can is only half empty, but why use it.
customer_reviews.author: Benjammin

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality !!
customer_reviews.text: Used as directed ... and after applying 4 coats of base and 4 coats of clear there is no way anyone would know this wasn’t professionally done and not sprayed on my carport. Took a while to cure due to the outdoor Louisiana humidity, so once sufficiently hardened approx 4 hours, I moved it inside where the lower humidity of my air conditioning could finish the drying process. I would definitely recommend this clear over any other!!!
customer_reviews.author: ericwp5

customer_reviews.title: 2 Step Prep!
customer_reviews.text: Product is great! However, covering the “how to” area of the can with an inventory sticker didn’t help out... its a 2-step setup! You got to take the red cap off the main top and place it at the bottom of the can. Hit it on a hard surface then Shake rigorously for 45sec-1min. I didn’t realize until half way through the can but the final product is great. Used it to clear hood the hood of my truck and looks/feels great. It will take over 12hours to dry. Just FYI!
customer_reviews.author: David Vega

customer_reviews.title: Just like my my spray gun w/2k clear!!!
customer_reviews.text: Cleaecoat spray pattern is fairly wide like a pro gun when spraying large panels. May be diffucult to paint small areas without causing runs. Other than that this stuff works amazing and will give professional results when utilized correctly. Yes its a 2k urethan clear coat. Yes its chemical resistant. And yes its super glossy with minimal orange peel. I did my Brembo Calipers for my Subie with this since i was too lazy set up my gun and came out superb. Would def reccomend over and over again!
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate Marbel

customer_reviews.title: May be a little pricier than others but u get what u pay for so don’t be a tight ass.
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again. Can still get a good result even spraying outside, after spraying I just brought it to my bathroom turned on the vent and ran a little space heater. Be sure u completely cover the parts ur not spraying, I didn’t cover the back side and got overspray I had to deal with after. Also it says it has a 48hr pot life but I used it 5 days after activating and worked great just left the can inside when I wasn’t using it.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M.

customer_reviews.title: Three tries to glossy finish
customer_reviews.text: No real instructions to get the glossy finish you want vs getting a wrong matte finish. First two tries I had to sand off the wrongfully matted clearcoats applied at a moderate distance and applied a third time by spraying in your face close with a 2nd can. Wasted 3 days to finally realize you need to be extremely close to the surface you're spraying to. Also, you need to be careful of overspray because the nozzle isn't very good. Hope the clearcoat lasts with the commitment I made on getting this on, otherwise I'll be extremely pissed.
customer_reviews.author: Frank K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product...
customer_reviews.text: This is the mack daddy of 2k clears....important to pay attention to flash times(10-15 mins) between 1st & 2nd coat...after that tacks up..lay on your wets coat or coats...dont over apply...let dry for 24 hr minimum...2-3 days is best...put it on an outboard & it's tough as nails....best used over poly base coat....no lacquer unless you let is gas off for a couple weeks
customer_reviews.author: mb

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: I saw this on YouTube and it works great. I saved a lot of money in touching up the car from the clear coat fading. Most paint shops will not do the one off jobs and then they want to paint the whole car. It is not for the novice painter but the quality is very good. Prepping the car is key. Very happy with this product and intend to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Zeca

customer_reviews.title: The best clear coat in a can.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. I wanted 2 stage protection from fuel spills. Painted my CX500 cafe racer. Three colors. I waited about a month before I buffed out the orange peel from my rattle can top coat. I used it over duplicolor, rattle can, acrylic topcoat. I waited about 4 days before applying it over the duplicolor. NO ADVERSE CHEMICAL REACTIONS. Worth the 22 bucks. Wear your respirator.
customer_reviews.author: Karl S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I use this stuff mainly for headlight restorations works great !
customer_reviews.author: Angelina M. McFarland

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste money
customer_reviews.text: Tried other clears and always not hard enough and gloss not very shiny. Spent the extra money and well worth it. This product gets hard as a rock and has a super shine. The product also coats thick (used 3 coats as recommended) unlike cheap clears that after many coats still seem like one thin coat. Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.author: TMB

customer_reviews.title: Looks Professional, excellent products
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing... Used it to clear coat over mirror caps and door handles that I painted to color match rest of truck on my 2020 Toyota Tundra Platinum, I hated the chrome...applied 3 coats of this after painting was done and it looks like they came from the factory... The shine is unbelievable, looks like it was professionally done...would highly recommend for anyone looking for that high gloss finish, best stuff you can buy out of a can, by far!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Flows out nicely
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. Used on a guitar refinishing. Have applied over shellac, dyed wood and even hand painted acrylic paint and have had no adhesion issues at all. Sanded flat and buffed it shines like glass. I use a turbine clean air full face system because this paint is very toxic. If wearing a cartridge respirator please check for proper compatibility. You only get one set of lungs. And I'd imagine enough of a concentration without proper protection would be fatal.
customer_reviews.author: hpo

customer_reviews.title: Not cheap, but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on several cars/car parts and other small project jobs. It does a fabulous job as long as you follow instructions (and USE A PROPER FILTER MASK!!). Lasting protection in California heat (100+ degrees) and rain/cold. Same goes for usage on electrical equipment (metal canister covers for vacuum tubes). Even spray coverage from every can so far (12+).
customer_reviews.author: Tekguild

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is THE BEST spray paint of any kind I have ever used. Used to paint some plastic parts I am going to put on my car. TIP: make sure you shake for two minutes then pop the pin in at the bottom with that red cap thing, then shake for two more minutes. Also, be aware it's a 12 hour dry time. Totally worth every penny and the wait for it to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Sluiter

customer_reviews.title: Professional results
customer_reviews.text: A whole different world from regular can clear coat. In moderate temperatures it smooths out beautifully. No runs or sags. Atomizes perfectly. Smooth even progressive coats result in a brilliant and smooth finish. After my 2nd can I was able to produce deep smooth clear coat that didn't need wet sanding or buffing to look perfect. With a little experience the results will make you look like a way better painter then you.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff. Use it for small stuff when I don't want to use a gun and waste a bottle of catalysts. Did some headlights a few years ago and they held up as well as the ones I've gunned on. This is for small areas in order to get good flowout and a glass like surface without color sanding. Remember to use the correct respirator to protect yourself. Catalysts will cause damage without it!!!!!. This is not like regular spray paint.
customer_reviews.author: lance monteros

customer_reviews.title: Better than most clearcoats
customer_reviews.text: If you want something that is more sturdy and will handle rockchips better, this is the product you want. After you mix the can you have a limited time to use up all the clear coat. Final product works very well. only downside is that its is a lot more expensive than the other clear coats.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Use outdoors - lots of ventilation - great finish - seems durable
customer_reviews.text: I had a painted metal license plate I wanted protected and high gloss. This was the perfect product for the job. I prepared the surface with 000 steel wool, wiped it down, then sprayed outside, with wind away from me. I had zero issues with the strong solvents used in this product. I wore gloves, mask and glasses - to be safe. It's more expensive than many, but the final result was great - I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: WileEC

customer_reviews.title: Sprayed globs & ruined touch-up paint job. Terrible Product
customer_reviews.text: Followed directions exactly & I have used 2 part clear-coats (another brand) so I am pretty sure I did things right. After releasing activator & shaking for over 2 minutes did test spray (which was fine) & then starting spraying paint job. Was going fine until 8 globs sprayed out about the size of a pencil eraser head. Let coat dry & the globs had eaten into the paint & ruined touch up paint job. This product is total junk & wish I could bill them for the time & material I used to do the touch up work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great for refinishing headlights
customer_reviews.text: I used it after polishing my oxidized headlight lenses. Made a clear glossy finish. Highly recommended but follow the directions and use outside if possible, especially if you don't have a mask, the fumes are somewhat dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Muleears

customer_reviews.title: Great product, terrible spray nozzle
customer_reviews.text: I could not get this stuff to spray on right, constantly orange-peeled, even after watching a bunch of videos on "the proper instructions." I've rattle-canned a lot of different stuff but this was by FAR the most difficult. I used it to restore headlights, and tried it on some recommendations, but I've gotten much easier applications from other products. I had to sand it out, to get a smooth finish. That said, it dried under a UV lamp in no time at all. I waited an hour to start sanding and it turned out fine. Seems like a durable finish, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Harder then it needs to be.
customer_reviews.text: I was testing this product against the one part clear coats. I used several different ones and was surprised to find a cheap one from the craft store was the best $3. This one works great, but it is haritjan it needs to be and it takes A LOT of sanding and buffing to clear it up.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Slomchinski

customer_reviews.title: Pro results for DIYers
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! Just follow directions and you'll have a fantastic durable finish. Absolutely worth the extra money! The only downside is if you need to paint just a small area, you need to know that this product is only good for 48 hours then the can gets tossed.
customer_reviews.author: Bechap

customer_reviews.title: It worked but is very potent
customer_reviews.text: I used this stuff on my water bottles after personalizing them. It worked well, product takes about a day to dry, I applied light coats every 5-10 minutes to get even coverage. when applying you should not use it too closely to the object or it will run, and you MUST shake it for at least two minutes prior to use or it doesnt come out right.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Poulsen

customer_reviews.title: Serious clear coat for serious projects.
customer_reviews.text: I use this product on goalie masks, airbrushed with createx wicked colors. Outstanding results that protect nicely from pucks. Easy to apply, assuming you take your time and wear the appropriate PPE and respirator when applying. Dries nicely, polishes right up. I'll continue to use, a personal favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Garandguy76

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Easy to evenly coated base coat but durability is still questionable because after year later clear coat is completely peeling off.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce L

customer_reviews.title: Works on bare steel and vinyl decals
customer_reviews.text: I used this on my cbr tank over paint, bare steel, vinyl decals, and water slide decals. Adhesion was great and looks professional. I scuffed the decals with 1200 before spraying and prepped the surface properly. I would recommend 2 cans if you are covering decals on a tank bacause it has to be very thick to fully cover the edges. Los of light coats then a thicker coat to finish is the ticket. I had a few runs that I will have to cut out but overall I am very happy with the result and will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Greer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best "spray can" finish on the market. I build guitars as a hobby and the finish I was able to produce with Spray Max 2K, is better than a spray-gun with a professional compressor, simply stunning. Will definitely re-purchase. There is a critical caveat, you must have adequate ventilation as well as a face mask. Please use proper protection...
customer_reviews.author: John Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Great clear coat
customer_reviews.text: I repainted my truck hood and finished it with an inferior clear coat and then bought this stuff to finish it off. This clear coat worked really well and went on really smooth. I used two cans of this clear coat could have used more. Good stuff. Very happy
customer_reviews.author: Durham

customer_reviews.title: worth the money
customer_reviews.text: very good. sprays evenly and offers a nice gloss finish that is very smooth. I'm not a very good painter but was impressed with how it turned out. Remember, (imo) prep is 50%, actual painting skill is 40% and the paint you use is 10% so if you have no idea how to paint or didn't prep well, or spray too close or too heavy, don't blame this product. However if you know what your doing, this is great.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Works but used with caution tends to splatter paint droplets
customer_reviews.text: Comes out in a nice fan pattern but be careful keep it vertical do not try spraying down onto the surface the paint coming out will glob and drop large droplets on to your work so that you have to come back sand it down and recoat. Also be sure the temperature is above 70° or it takes forever to flash over so you can put on a second coat.
customer_reviews.author: bondo

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I did something wrong but it started pealing and bubbling up bad just a couple of months.the process I did on my front bumper was to wet sand, prime 3 coats, wet sand, base coat 3 coats , 2k clear coat 3 coats.
customer_reviews.author: Thatoneguy89

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Great Product !
customer_reviews.text: Don't ask if you should buy it, just order it now. Painted my motorcycle and cleared it with this. Sprays just like a gun and goes a long way too. I am in love and will be ordering more on my next projects to come. Thanks and wear a respirator this is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan pearson

customer_reviews.title: Great value, professional results.
customer_reviews.text: Used this product to clear coat my carbon fiber hood, it turned out really well with the correct preparation and it looks great. Fairly easy to use only thing I had a problem with is you had to keep it upright while spraying like any other spray paint. Would definitely recommend this over something like rustoleums 2k clear coat. After a couple weeks it still looks great but only time will tell if it holds up in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely excellent 2K clear!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely excellent 2k clear coat! Very easy to use, sprays beautifully and hardens to a mirror finish with the benefits of being gas and oil resistant. Used to clear coat a motorcycle fuel tank over aluminum Rustoleum enamel spray paint. Three coats of clear, dried overnight to a stunning gloss. Kind of expensive, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: The Yoginator

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: It makes a good and smooth, fairly transparent coating, but it is sprayed terribly wide, completely unsuitable for small areas of damage, as it fills everything around with a finger. And for large works, a spray will not be enough
customer_reviews.author: Ildar

customer_reviews.title: Liquid glass
customer_reviews.text: This was used for headlight lens, I've also used it on rifle stocks...This is the ultimate gloss finish....take your time, prep, light coats.....
customer_reviews.author: rsb

customer_reviews.title: Great finish, perfect product.
customer_reviews.text: Used this to paint the tank on my motorcycle. If you know how to paint with a rattle can, this is an amazing product. Do a few light passes, avoiding buildup and running and you will have a perfect finish. Just remember that 90% of painting is in the prep work. Also, don't forget to wear a mask; this stuff is toxic.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Clemens

customer_reviews.title: Protected my headlights for two years
customer_reviews.text: Used this to redo my headlights. Perhaps it was my technique, but there was a noticeable amount of orange peel effect. Overall, I was happy with the final product. The layer is peeling off two years later.
customer_reviews.author: piccolojan2

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but great stuff.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! It is pretty expensive but great if you are clearing a small project. I bought it to do my motorcycle and it was everything that I needed in a can. This is some strong stuff so make sure you wear a respirator and eye goggles...also use it in a well ventilated place or outside.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mcpherson

customer_reviews.title: Like a pro at home
customer_reviews.text: For sure the closest thing to professional you can get at home without an air gun. Used this on my motorcycle and it looks fantastic. Gotta be careful to get a slightly thicker coat then you need though, if you spray too light it gets a texture and even close to matte in some places.
customer_reviews.author: Zack W.

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by an auto paint guy. Even though I watched the videos, I was not aware I needed to wet sand and polish to get a smooth finish. Ended up trying to wet sand a polish, but failed and ended up sanding and repainting. Just needed a nice simple spray on automotive gloss coat. :-(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: English instructions, NOPE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product, the date stamp was from Feb 2019,so good to go. However, this particular can, and I'm sure the lot being sold was intended for the Latin market. All of the instructions are in Spanish, instructions are in English on the internet. Sprays smooth, leaves a nice shine.
customer_reviews.author: Carla

customer_reviews.title: Professional finish from a spray can!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! Very professional appearing finish. Doesn't drip easily, which is important cause the thicker you apply it the easier it is to get a glossy finish that requires minimal to no polishing. I had my color matched paint mixed at the local Auto paint shop, couldn't be happier. I bought 2 only used 1 but am confident I will find a use for the other one. I do recommend getting a spray paint can handle to get better ergonomics while painting.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: Factory clear coat!
customer_reviews.text: Works like described. This stuff is like factory clear coat
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Clear Coat
customer_reviews.text: This paint is highly toxic, as I guess any catalyzed paint. I wore a one piece paint suit, gloves, goggles and a paint mask designed for the task. Mask everything you don't want painted, it gets everywhere and is very sticky. I got some on the eyeglasses and it took me a while to get it off. The product sprays well, better than standard rattle can. I applied three coats to an auto panel and was able to sand and buff out any mistakes.
customer_reviews.author: LIFX User

customer_reviews.title: would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: used to respray a panel on my car. more than enough to do a whole quarter panel with multiple coats. got a little orange peel but i was also spraying outdoors in windy conditions. would be hard to go back to a "off the shelf" rattle can clear after using this.
customer_reviews.author: vanessa

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money on this crap!!
customer_reviews.text: Tried this on my bumper. This crap does not work. Cost me $300 to repaint bumper. It is not a gloss clear coat. It is a matte finish and looks like crap.
customer_reviews.author: Cdawg

customer_reviews.title: Best Clear Coat Ever
customer_reviews.text: Many say not gloss. I have been using this clear coat for years. Apply min 3-4 coats and you will have a supper gloss finish. I also wait 2-3 days for my base coat to dry before spraying clear coat. GREAT STUFF!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Paquette

customer_reviews.title: Great product! You WILL need a respirator
customer_reviews.text: Great product! You WILL need a respirator. Take your time and go slow when using - otherwise it will orange peel.
customer_reviews.author: Dean A.

customer_reviews.title: With all the good reviews it must have been a bad can but ...
customer_reviews.text: When popped the bottom in all came out the bottom of the can. With all the good reviews it must have been a bad can but not gonna try this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Professional Results
customer_reviews.text: I have tried different brands for small projects. This one is the best. The downside, once you activate it you got 48 hours to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Unbiased

customer_reviews.title: Clear coat after 5-6months
customer_reviews.text: So I’m giving this product a review at a 3/5 After applying it an waiting 6months My clear coat in certain areas started to chip off. In pieces. Maybe it’s a bad batch or elements. Unfortunately it’s a draw back from something. Mind you i did paint and prep them correctly. I also let it harden over a 7day process and still 6months later chipped
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with this can!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been looking for a good clear coat alternative from home, I do some airbrush work and didn’t want to pay a shop to clear coat. Found this can and am super impressed with the gloss and feel! The hardener really gives this a professional auto body feel, and easy to apply in a few light coats.
customer_reviews.author: Vinnie

customer_reviews.title: check vedios there aren't any instructions on use when reading label. make sure it's compatable with the paint you want to spray
customer_reviews.text: I Very Highly Recommend this I used rust-oleum clear enamel It doesn't compare to 2K Glamour I received this yesterday an sprayed early in A.M. This is a profession result just need to buff out I used a respirator there are u-tube videos of people bought a have some explanation on how to use this product. My bass guitar looks as if a pro refinished it. I will definitely buy this over any clear worth the extra few dollars for any product. I used rust-oleum seaside blue
customer_reviews.author: skw1engineer

customer_reviews.title: Good tough spray on paint coating.
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. This clear covering for painted surfaces is very hard and makes paint less likely to chip. However, if you later want to touch-up you will have to vigorously sand. You MUST use this outside with highest quality breathing filters. This isn't paint..it is basically spraying on super glue!
customer_reviews.author: Guzzer

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, this is what you are looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this product, absolutely outstanding finished, OMG if you really wanted a nice clear finished this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Eusebio E. Sarmiento

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: A little orange peeling but goes on easy and with only 10 minutes between coats. Can’t speak for durability yet but so far it looks fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jim D. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Save money and do it yourself !
customer_reviews.text: This is great stuff. Follow the directions and use a respirator. I’ve used this to restore several headlights on different cars and the results are really impressive. Make sure to let it dry the full 24hours before doing any sort of final polishing. If you search “ how to restore headlights “ on YouTube there is a great video that walks you through the process.
customer_reviews.author: Denis G

customer_reviews.title: Best aeresol clear there is
customer_reviews.text: This is the best aeresol clear you can get. 2k products are superior to 1k in every way. This product lays down perfect. The nozzle provides great atomization allowing you to achieve a finish that mimics that of a spray gun. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Archie

customer_reviews.title: Buy this one, thank me later.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I used this the first time. The finish is so much smoother than other brands. There really is no substitute if you are doing your own clear coat.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: Dont recommends
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand why review 5 star. It isnt shiny .
customer_reviews.author: James Lee

customer_reviews.title: Best clear coat out there for d.i.y
customer_reviews.text: If you are ever going to try to rattle can touch up your car I highly recommend this clear coat. I never used this product before but when I say this is the best it really is, you get a super shiny gloss like it was professionally done, I did have a little orange peel but I wet sanded after 7 days and buffed and looks perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: USC SprayMax 2K Glamour High Gloss Aerosol Clear
product_meta.description: ? Spray Max 2K Glamour High Gloss Aerosol Clear. A 2 component aerosol clearcoat that is easy to apply, flows smooth and dries to a long lasting, high gloss finish ? 2K clearcoat in an easy to use aerosol ? Activate, shake and spray ? Unique nozzle delivers spray gun results ? Dries to a high gloss finish ? Excellent weather and chemical resistance ? Color: Clear liquid (as packaged) ? Mix: Ready to spray. Activate, shake and spray ? Substrate: Properly applied basecoats ? Suggested Use: For use over all basecoats.
feature_bullets: Spraymax 2k Glamour High Gloss Aerosol Clear Part # 3680061
Maximum resistance to abrasion and scratching

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars1,222 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
